results.title: The Accursed architect
results.creator_credit: Pierre Cast and La Societe Nouvelle Pathe-Cinema
results.brief_description: An investigation of the work and theories of Claude-Nicolas Ledoux, 1736-1806, an architect and innovator two centuries before his time. Initially he created chateaux for the French nobility, but later he became an urbanist, designing houses and cities for the working man. However, his utopian dream that architecture should be related to daily life was not realised.

results.title: Accountancy today!
results.brief_description: A career film. An Accountant needs an inquiring mind and the ability to communicate effectively; he must collect and record facts, analyse them, prepare reports, discuss financial implications, control their results. After a three year full-time course of study at a university or technical college, he can gain employment in a secure, well-paid position which may lead to promotion to top executive positions in commerce, industry, government departments or private practice.

results.title: According to the evidence
results.brief_description: Scenes in a committal hearing and in court with a jury are created and structured to present, for the benefit of law students, the problems, laws and precedents regarding the nature and admissibility of evidence

results.title: According to specification?
results.creator_credit: Phil Dennis, Denis Ward, British Productivity Council and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: The problem of maintaining a consistent quality standard in manufactured products is discussed by a Production Director and a Sales Director. Conventional methods of inspection between processes and again of the final product prove too costly, and it is decided that quality control should become part of the manufacturing process. The practical, theoretical and statistical aspects of quality control are fully developed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Dennis, Denis Ward, British Productivity Council and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: The Accessible Arctic
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Convincing evidence of the growing advance of industry and settlement in the Canadian far north. New roads, railways and airfields have brought the once isolated northern communities into the mainstream of Canadian life and progress. Explains how this is being done and shows some of the people who are doing it. Among these are Indian and Eskimo graduates of the new trade schools.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Access: experiment in Port Adelaide
results.brief_description: Patterned on the Canadian “Challenge for Change” experiments, this is an example of the video access concept at work for the Department of Social Security, helping to cut down the often mythical barriers between citizens and Government Departments involved in social welfare. No other credits available.
